column4: Whenever I use apt-get to try and install a package and that package fails for whatever reason.... Any subsequent apt-get calls to try and install anything else.... it always tries to install the first failed package.... any ideas?
what does sudo apt-get update do?
it just seems to go and grab the latest stuff as usual... why?
making sure your repos are straight
alright... well yeah that seems fine
do you have any 3rd party repos added?
nah.... ZoneMinder is part of the defaults
im aware of this but im starting to think a 3rd party repo may be giving you the bad path
hmm.. well I didn't add anything so can't be that
which package is it failing on? seems to be installing for me so far
Starting ZoneMinder: DBI connect('database=zm;host=localhost','zmuser',...) failed: Unknown database 'zm' at /usr/share/perl5/ZoneMinder/Config.pm line 89
doesn't seem to have setup mysql for me correctly
lol you said you were getting an error from sudo apt-get install, not from running the app itself
thats a whole diff story then
ok did you sudo apt-get install it or did you compile it from source?
when i apt-get it, it installs mysql for me
